comments.commentBody: I actually loved his last years' Golden Globes performance. Maybe it's his accent. I don't know but his "abrasive" personality made it more humorous, IMHO.

Though I have loved him in The Office, and have enjoyed some of his other performances, I have to say as a host I find him (or his persona) annoying, abrasive, and not one bit as funny or talented as he finds him to be.  Thank goodness for DVR.
Right on, Peter! Right on!

Bill, I am sorry I don't follow your logic.  To use your logic, if a church is exempt from paying taxes on real property, they should then be exempt from services that a government provides, such as police and fire protection.  The church should also be exempt from accepting any funding from a government for any services they provide such as education and the such.   If a church accepts any funding from a government then they have to accept the strings that may or may not come with the funding.

“The return on investment on a college degree has risen dramatically” Really?
Your whole Premise is dubious at the best.
Did you take into consideration that millions, yes, millions college graduates Perform jobs don’t even require college degree in this nation.
Before 1980’s, there were very few college graduates employed in service sector.
Today, you can easily find many college graduates working in retail and food service, etc.
My assessment is different: Getting a Degree: Less Rigor, less Value,
More debt.
It is healthy to challenge conventional wisdom and to question our preconceived notion.

Lyle Vos -faux candidate - was referring to Omarosa (Manigualt-Stallworth), but attempting to again smear the First Lady with another one of his outrageous lies.

With her controversial behavior, Omarosa soon became the "woman America loved to hate" and was named by E! as reality TV's No. 1 bad girl. However, Omarosa claims the show's producers manipulated the footage to make her look like the villain, and said, "These shows are constructed. They don't happen, nor do they portray actual reality. They are constructed reality." She added, "Historically, blacks have been portrayed negatively on reality television. We don't come across well. You've got to start looking and saying, 'Is that really how all blacks are?' Because they are trying to say that this is representative of our people."

Omarosa is not Michelle Obama, Lyle. Grow up.

No Lyle. Connie Schultz' comment wasn't about skin color. It also wasn't religion considering that Senator Brown is Jewish and Ms. Schultz is not, and Ms. Schultz has written about that for her readers.

The comment is about being the spouse of an elected official and held to a certain ideal by the public as to how a spouse should act and behavior - and living in a glass house under scrutiny where every move is seen and commented upon.
Stop being disingenuous, Ted.  Everyone knows why.  Rather late in the day to profess befuddlement.
Amen!  What a crock!
That would be because of a little thing called the Constitution.
Sad day for human rights and human beings. Why do we refuse to tax these immense organizations and their leaders?

Gee, Billy D. Kidd, you're right about the doomed socialist campaign - but its that of Willard Mittford "Vulture Looter" Romney.

That's what "Angry" Newt Gingrich and Rick "0.07%" Perry labelled Romney the other day when they criticized him for looting and destroying corporations as head of Bain Capital and ruining people's livelihoods.

Hey, can't wait for Callista Gingrich - an admitted adulter - to be First Lady.

Or should I say "First Adulteress."

Michelle Obama is far and away preferable - with far more dignity, grace and respect.

Yea, and the Obamas' fist-bump was not some ""terrorist fist jab" as Fox News, Rush Limbaugh and the right sought to portray.

Unless the NY Yankees back in 2000 were giving terrorist fist bumps to each other as they marched toward winning the AL East, AL pennant and then the World Series over the NY Mets.

$450 sneakers at a GOP-let'm-eat-cake food bank?

Barbara Bush had diamonds on the soles of her shoes when she visited those poor Katrina victims ... oh wait, she just insulted them from a distance.

http://www.nytimes.com/2005/09/07/national/nationalspecial/07barbara.html

If the $540 sneaker fits Michelle.....than wear it, but this time I suggest you don't wear them to the foodbank.

It looks as clueless as you sound.

Right on Bill!! And don't take vacations at Christmas when the staff should be with their families, like the Bushes did.
They never left until the day after Christmas to give their staff and Secret Service people time with their families and they went to Camp David. This has already been documented.
Barjack - They pretend to be all worried about the carbon
footprint and then take separate planes and several planes to their destinations, plus autos, staff, etc. They are trying to pretend to be royalty and are the laughing stock of the European countries visit. Notice how they didn't even get an invite to the Royal Wedding? We pay for all this except for a few incidentals, even the MSM gets this.Get more facts before you post.

Why is it when the libs don't agree with someone, they immediately call them a racist?? It's sort of a worn out
slogan and has no meaning due to it's daily use!

Paulie, we don't hate the Obama's, we just don't like what they are doing to our country. There is a difference whether you recognize it or not! History will show he was the worst President ever, far surpassing Carter.
Stop with all the hate and racists liberal mantra!
It's gettin old and irrelevant!

Bash all the candidates wives and then complain that someone wrote a not too flattering book about Michelle?
Do I detect a double standard here.

The Campaigner-in-Chief, at his lying best re: "being focused on the
critical items on his agenda'' as the POTUS. ...as he flits from one
fund=raiser to another. Appalling, at the very least.
Say it ain't so, Barak
He might as well campaign--the GOP is stonewalling everything in DC. Talk about your Do Nothing Congress.
You already answered that in the affirmative, at least regarding yourself. Find something productive to do, unlike the Republicans in Congress.

So, obviously, the White House is lying to the American People when they insist President Obama is not in campaign mode as he flies to fundraisers followed by yet more fundraisers all on the taxpayer's dime while joblessness still lingers and people continue to lose their trust in our Government.

Do they think we're stupid or something? (Don't answer that)
Why does it matter? You wouldn't like him no matter what he did.

Nope.  None of those activities are related to being in campaign mode. Not one.  He's obviously so immersed in running the country (into the ground) that there is no time to raise oodles of filthy lucre from the 1% that he is currently demonizing.  But he's assured them that their contributions will be used to demonize congress instead.  Nope.  Glad he's on the job and not out wasting time campaigning.
He really ought to get into that campaign mode sooner than later. Fund raising is important but so is establishing your message.
Obama to the GOP--I'm trying to create jobs faster than you can distroy them.

Oh baby, this is some hard hitting journalism. News flash, popular incumbent President does what it takes to continue to operate in the best interests of the country and her citizens.

Are you implying that someone else is doing more for the welfare of the country than he is? Because it certainly isn't any of his colleagues in Congress, and it certainly isn't any of those pathetic ankle biters puking lies all over SC right now.

Hmm... Romney suggests a bet of $10K, NYT reports he's out of touch with an average American.

NYT asserts that Obama understands an average American while attending two parties in one night, where tickets are priced $7K and $16K a piece.

And that on top of his press secretary lying with a straight face that Obama isn't in a campaign mode (let alone that he's been in that mode since Dec at least if not since 2009).

Well, Romney at least does not pretend making nice and as such commands more respect, that is compared to Obama.

Politics has always been about the lesser of two evils. Clinton was bad enough, but Bob Dole would've been far worse IMO. Likewise with Obama. Actually it is Congress that is passing laws, not Obama though Obama should veto some of them. He still is trying to unify the country and be the president of all people, as he should be, but it is not working in a deeply divided country.
